title: Cognitive Distortions
answer: Notice thinking patterns like all-or-nothing, mind reading, or catastrophizing. Challenge them with balanced alternatives.
steps: Write the thought exactly as it appears.
Ask: what is an evidence-based alternative thought?

title: Thought Record
answer: Use a thought record: situation, emotions (0–100), automatic thought, evidence for/against, balanced thought, outcome.

title: Behavioral Activation
answer: Schedule small, meaningful activities to lift mood. Action leads, motivation follows.
steps: Do it regardless of mood; review after.

title: Exposure (Anxiety)
answer: Create a gradual exposure ladder. Facing fears in small, repeated steps reduces anxiety over time.
steps: List steps from easiest to hardest.
Practice the easiest step repeatedly until anxiety drops.
Move up one step at a time.

title: General
answer: Name the thought, breathe slowly, and test it against facts. Plan one tiny action aligned with your values today.
